row.cell: Chloe and a friend are ordering pizza. They have a choice between a Medium or Large Pizza as shown in the diagrams above.

How many square inches is the Medium Pizza?
\displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}

How many square inches is the Large Pizza?
\displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}
The diameter of the Large pizza is times as large as the Medium Pizza.
The area of the Large pizza is times as large as the Medium Pizza.
If the Medium Pizza costs \displaystyle{15}, how much should the Large pizza cost to be of equal value?

cell.em: Pizza Math Moral: Unless you have a coupon or there is a special deal going on, it is almost always a better value to order the larger pizza!
